definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
lit. has a name but no reality (idiom); exists only in name/nominal
lit. to have sufficient reason to send troops (idiom)/to do something with good reason/to have just cause
lit. has a name but no reality (idiom); exists only in name/nominal

sentences.english: This is a famous gray-beard gathering place.
sentences.chinese: 这儿是一个有名的老年人聚集的地方。

sentences.english: Can you tell us your thoughts about how Golden Gate became so famous?
sentences.chinese: 那你能谈下为什么金门会如此有名吗？

sentences.english: W1: There are many famous newspapers.
Speaking of Fortune kiln, not only hemp cities, mountains are famous throughout the eastern Hubei.
sentences.chinese: 说起富鑫窑，不单麻城市，整个鄂东山区都赫赫有名。

sentences.english: He set on people to persuade him to wrestle with the famous wrestler .
sentences.chinese: 他嗾使人去劝他跟那个有名的摔跤师去摔跤。

sentences.english: B. Pick out the proper nouns in the following sentences.
sentences.chinese: 试选出以下句子中的专有名词。

sentences.english: The Jiangsu cooking style is known for its wide variety of ingredients and sweetish flavor.
sentences.chinese: 苏菜以其佐料的多样性和甜味而有名。

sentences.english: The Hot pot from Sichuan, and Shen jian bao from Shanghai have become two of those "must-haves".
sentences.chinese: 中国的四川麻辣火锅和上海生煎包榜上有名。

sentences.english: Gion Matsuri, which is one of the most famous festivals in Japan, takes place in Kyoto, too.
sentences.chinese: 日本最有名庆典之一的祇园祭也在京都举行。

sentences.english: Perhaps you want to document the full scope of your cross-industry experience, much of which occurred in your early career.
sentences.chinese: 或许你更早的一些的工作是在比较有名气的公司里。

sentences.english: This is in the bright history famous "the red pill document".
sentences.chinese: 这就是明历史上有名的“红丸案”。

sentences.english: It has just come to our notice that the Japanese camera canon manufactured by seiki- kogaku, tokyo, is very popular.
sentences.chinese: 久闻东京精机光学厂生产的“佳能”照相机颇有名气。

sentences.english: Mana Lisa probably is the world's most famous portrait.
sentences.chinese: 他的《蒙娜丽莎》是世界上最有名的人物肖像画。

sentences.english: Jia Sixie is well-known as a pioneer in farming.
sentences.chinese: 贾思勰是一位有名的农学先驱。

sentences.english: The Red Rose Restaurant in Maple Road is very famous.
sentences.chinese: 枫林街的“红玫瑰”餐厅很有名。

sentences.english: I went to Tainan and enjoyed the attractions, then Lugang the historical town.
sentences.chinese: 我到了台南有名的景点，然后是具有历史意义的鹿港。

definition: well-known for sth/to become well known/to make one's mark
to be famous far and wide (idiom)
understood by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
to achieve fame among one's contemporaries (idiom); temporary or local celebrity
seasoned/honed to perfection over centuries/special reserve
